name: Electrical Safety Inspection & Certification
description: Peace of mind starts with knowing your electrical system is safe. Solomon Electric provides comprehensive electrical safety inspections and professional certifications for South Florida homeowners and professionals—covering everything from 4-point insurance inspections and pre-purchase audits to real estate certifications. Our licensed electricians identify hidden hazards, verify code compliance, and deliver the official documentation you need for insurance, sales, or total peace of mind.
warningSignsHeading: When You Need Electrical Inspection & Certification
warningSignsSubheading: Whether for safety, compliance, or transactions, professional documentation ensures your system meets standard requirements.

problems.title: Insurance & 4-Point Needs
problems.description: Florida insurers often require specific 4-point inspections for older homes or policy renewals. We provide accepted documentation they require.

problems.title: Home Buying & Due Diligence
problems.description: General home inspections miss critical electrical hazards. A dedicated audit reveals hidden issues before you commit to a major investment.

problems.title: Selling or Real Estate Closing
problems.description: Proactive safety certification facilitates smoother transactions and prevents last-minute negotiation surprises regarding electrical condition.

problems.title: Home is Over 25 Years Old
problems.description: Electrical systems age invisibly. Wiring insulation degrades and standards evolve. Older homes often have hidden hazards needing attention.

problems.title: Planning Major Renovations
problems.description: Before investing in renovations, understand your system's capacity. Inspections reveal what upgrades you'll need to support your plans.

problems.title: Safety & Code Compliance
problems.description: Flickering lights or tripping breakers are warning signs. We identify code violations and hazardous DIY work hiding behind your walls.

process.title: Electrical Panel & Capacity Review
process.description: We inspect your main panel for sizing, recalled brands (Federal Pacific, Zinsco), connection quality, and signs of overheating or arcing.

process.title: Wiring & Connection Assessment
process.description: We examine accessible wiring for type (copper vs aluminum), condition, and code violations in attics, crawlspaces, and service points.

process.title: Outlet, Switch & Safety Testing
process.description: We test outlets for polarity and grounding. We verify GFCI and AFCI protection works correctly in required safety zones.

process.title: Documentation & Issue Identification
process.description: We document all findings with photographs and categorize any deficiencies as immediate hazards, code updates, or future goals.

process.title: Official Report & Certification
process.description: You receive a professional written report and, if qualified, the safety certification needed for insurance or real estate transactions.

benefits.title: Insurer Accepted Documentation
benefits.description: Our detailed reports satisfy Florida insurance requirements and 4-point inspection formats for policy issuance or renewal.

benefits.title: Negotiation & Market Value
benefits.description: Documented electrical health provides leverage in real estate negotiations, whether you're asking for repairs or proving a home's value.

benefits.title: Identify Hidden Hazards
benefits.description: Electrical fires often start behind walls. Professional inspection catches issues before they become disasters, protecting your family.

benefits.title: Prioritized Action Plan
benefits.description: Not everything needs immediate attention. We give you a clear roadmap of what's urgent versus what can wait, helping you budget wisely.

faqs.question: What is the difference between this and a home inspection?
faqs.answer: Significantly different. General home inspectors check basic functions—a 5-10 minute review. Professional electrical inspections involve deep examination by licensed electricians who understand code requirements, hidden hazards, and system integrity.

faqs.question: Is this the same as a 4-point inspection?
faqs.answer: We provide the comprehensive electrical component of the 4-point inspection. We deliver the specific documentation required by Florida insurers to verify the panel, wiring, and safety systems meet their coverage standards.

faqs.question: What happens if you find serious problems?
faqs.answer: If we identify immediate safety hazards (fire risks or shock hazards), we explain the situation clearly and recommend immediate fixes. For other items, we include them in a prioritized report so you can plan repairs on your timeline.

faqs.question: Can you provide certification for real estate closings?
faqs.answer: Yes. We offer pre-purchase and pre-sale inspection certifications that provide the documentation buyers, lenders, and real estate professionals need to proceed with confidence.

faqs.question: How long does the inspection take?
faqs.answer: Typically 1-2 hours depending on the home size. We are methodical and do not rush. You will receive your written report and any applicable certifications within 24-48 hours.

faqs.question: Will an old panel fail the inspection automatically?
faqs.answer: Age alone isn't always a failure, but safety and condition are. However, certain recalled brands like Federal Pacific or Zinsco are known hazards and will be noted as such, as most insurers require their replacement for coverage.

seoContent.heading: Certified Electrical Safety Inspections in South Florida
seoContent.body: Solomon Electric provides the professional electrical safety inspections and certifications required for Florida's unique real estate and insurance market. Serving Miami-Dade, Broward, and Palm Beach counties, our licensed electricians deliver the 4-point inspection data and safety certifications you need to maintain coverage or close a sale.

seoContent.heading: 4-Point Insurance & Real Estate Documentation
seoContent.body: Florida insurance companies increasingly require electrical documentation for policy renewals, especially on homes over 25 years old. Our inspection reports are designed to satisfy insurer requirements, documenting connection quality, testing GFCI function, and identifying recalled equipment before it causes a problem.

seoContent.heading: Peace of Mind for Home Buyers & Sellers
seoContent.body: Don't inherit someone else's electrical mistakes. Our pre-purchase inspections identify unpermitted DIY work, code violations, and aging infrastructure that general home inspectors miss. For sellers, proactive certification ensures your home is market-ready and prevents last-minute negotiation credits.

seoContent.heading: Honest Assessments, Professional Results
seoContent.body: We don't create unnecessary work. Our reports prioritize findings by urgency—immediate safety hazards vs. code updates vs. future improvements. You'll understand exactly what's important for your safety and your property value.
